---
title: "Tidy Tuesday!"
---

[Tidy Tuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday) is a weekly data project from the [Data Science Learning Community](https://dslc.io/). The data is shared every Monday [here](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday) and on [these social media platforms](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/dataset_announcements.md). If you are new to working with data, it is a great way to get practice! There are clear instructions for how to load each dataset into R, Python, and Julia. Tidy Tuesday also has a supportive online presence and it is encouraged to share what you create on social media---just follow [these guidelines](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/sharing.md).

I first started doing Tidy Tuesday when I took my first data science class in 2021. Challenging myself to find creative ways to visualize data and tell a story remains one of my favorite aspects of statistics. This page includes all my Tidy Tuesdays from most recent to oldest. Feel free to click on the image to see the corresponding code. While I often don't have time to participate, I enjoy following #TidyTuesday on Bluesky to get inspiration. One of my favorite Tidy Tuesday creators is Nicola Rennie, check out [her respository](https://github.com/nrennie/tidytuesday) to see some pretty cool visualizations!
